item.title: About
item.description: My name is Matthew Maciejewski and I am currently a PhD student in Electrical & Computer Engineering at Johns Hopkins University in the Center for Speech and Language Processing doing speech processing. My areas of expertise are in deep learning, statistical modeling, and signal processing. In particular, I am interested in conversational speech, working with far-field recordings of speech with multiple people talking. Most recently, I have been working on speech separation, the task of producing a single audio waveform for each speaker in a recording where multiple people are speaking at the same time.

item.title: Publications
item.description: work in progress M. Maciejewski, J. Shi, S. Watanabe, S. Khudanpur. Training Noisy Single-Channel Speech Separation With Noisy Oracle Sources: A Large Gap and A Small Step. IEEE ICASSP (in review). 2021 [arXiv] M. Maciejewski, G. Wichern, E. McQuinn, J. Le Roux. WHAMR!:Noisy and Reverberant Single-Channel Speech Separation. IEEE ICASSP. 2020 [arXiv]
